security: Transmitting photocopies of Timothy Leary's documents could reveal the CIA's interest in Leary, his associates, and activities, potentially compromising ongoing intelligence efforts. The reference to 'BS Leary Sens' suggests sensitivity surrounding Leary. Sharing specific details from the documents could also expose sources and methods used to gather information. To prevent this the document states "RETURN TO CIA Background Use Only Do Not Reproduce".
summary: A CIA dispatch from the Chief of Station in Copenhagen to the Chief of WOMUSE, with information to the Chief of the European Division, transmitting photocopies of Timothy Leary's documents related to RYBAT MHCHAOS.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET/RYBAT dispatch, dated May 19, 1971, is from the Chief of Station in Copenhagen to the Chief of WOMUSE, informing the Chief of the European Division of the transmittal of photocopies of Timothy Leary's documents, which are relevant to RYBAT MHCHAOS and were discussed in referenced communications. The dispatch includes instructions for distribution and notes that the documents are for background use only and should not be reproduced.
title: Transmittal of Timothy LEARY Documents
